Soil: Clay loam or silty loam soil, pH 5.5–7.5
Climate: Tropical climate with 20–37°C temperature and 100–200 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Keep the field flooded after transplanting, then alternate wetting and drying; about 5–6 irrigations in Kharif.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 100:50:50 at planting per hectare. Top dressing: 40 kg N later.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for stem borer and brown planthopper. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest at 75–80% maturity (grains hard, ~18–20% moisture). Cut with sickle or combine.
Storage: Sun-dry grains to ~12–14% moisture. Winnow and store in airtight containers or bags in a cool, dry place.

Soil: Loamy soil, well-drained, pH 6.0–7.5
Climate: Cool climate with 10–25°C temperature and 30–75 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Give 4–5 irrigations: one after sowing, then at tillering, flowering and dough stages; use flood or sprinkler irrigation if available.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 60:40:20 at sowing per hectare, then top-dress 60 kg N later (split in 2 stages).
Pests & Weeds: Watch for aphids and armyworm. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest at full maturity (~20% grain moisture). Cut with sickle or combine.
Storage: Dry grains to <12% moisture. Clean and store in cool, dry, airtight storage (fumigate if needed).

Soil: Deep, well-drained loamy soil, pH 6.0–7.5
Climate: Warm climate with 20–30°C temperature and 50–100 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Irrigate soon after sowing and give 4–5 irrigations during crop; skip watering before harvest to dry cobs.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 80:60:40 at planting per hectare. Top dress 70 kg N later.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for stem borers and fall armyworm. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest when husks are dry and grains have ~20% moisture (60–90 days after sowing). Husks should turn brown.
Storage: Dry cobs in sun; shell grains and store dry in airtight containers or jute bags.

Soil: Loamy or sandy soil, pH 6.5–7.5
Climate: Warm climate with 25–30°C temperature and 50–100 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Rabi mostly rainfed; in Kharif give 2–3 irrigations (after sowing and at flowering).
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 60:30:20 at planting per hectare. Top dress 40 kg N later.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for shoot fly and stem borer. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest at full grain maturity (panicles dry and hard). Cut panicles and sun-dry to thresh grains.
Storage: Dry grains to safe moisture and store in clean, insect-free bags or bins.

Soil: Sandy loam to loamy soil, pH 6.0–7.5
Climate: Hot, dry climate with 30–35°C temperature and 20–50 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Usually rainfed; one irrigation at flowering if dry.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 60:30:20 at sowing per hectare.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for earhead grasshopper and stem borer. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest when grains are hard and panicles golden brown (around 70–80 days). Cut panicles and dry before threshing.
Storage: Dry grains well to 12% moisture; store in airtight bags to prevent pests.

Soil: Loamy to black soil, pH 6.0–7.5
Climate: Warm, humid climate with 25–30°C temperature and 60–100 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Rainfed; give 1–2 light irrigations if needed at tillering.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 60:30:20 at sowing per hectare.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for blast disease and aphids. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest when earheads turn pale and grain is firm (around 90–100 days). Cut and sun-dry, then thresh to collect grains.
Storage: Dry well to 12% moisture; store in jute or polythene bags in cool, dry place.

Soil: Loamy to black soil, pH 7.0–8.0
Climate: Cool climate with 15–25°C temperature and 50–75 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Rainfed; if irrigation is available give one irrigation at flowering and pod development.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 20:20:0 at sowing per hectare (mostly phosphorus and potassium because chickpea fixes nitrogen).
Pests & Weeds: Watch for pod borer and aphids. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest when pods turn yellow-brown and dry (around 100–110 days). Pull plants or cut stems, then thresh to collect grains.
Storage: Dry well to <12% moisture; store in airtight containers to prevent pest entry.

Soil: Black or clay loam soil, pH 6.0–8.0
Climate: Warm climate with 25–30°C temperature and 50–100 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Rainfed; if irrigated give one irrigation at flowering and pod filling.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 20:40:20 at planting per hectare (phosphorus emphasis).
Pests & Weeds: Watch for pod borers and pod fly. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest when pods mature and start drying (around 120–150 days). Cut plants or pick pods and sun-dry before threshing.
Storage: Dry pods fully; thresh and store grains in airtight sacks to avoid infestation.

Soil: Light to medium loam soil, pH 6.0–7.0
Climate: Warm climate with 25–30°C temperature and 50–100 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Rainfed; if needed irrigate once at flowering.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 15:30:10 at sowing per hectare.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for aphids and whitefly. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest when pods become brown and dry (around 60–70 days). Pull plants or cut and dry pods before threshing.
Storage: Dry completely and store seeds in airtight containers to prevent storage pests.

Soil: Loamy to clay loam soil, pH 6.0–7.0
Climate: Warm climate with 25–30°C temperature and 60–120 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Rainfed; irrigate once at flowering if available.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 20:20:0 at planting per hectare.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for aphids and powdery mildew. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest when leaves drop and pods turn brown (around 70–80 days). Pull plants and dry; thresh to collect grains.
Storage: Dry seeds to <12% moisture and store in sealed bags to protect from pests.

Soil: Well-drained loamy soil, pH 7.0–8.0
Climate: Cool climate with 15–25°C temperature and 30–50 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Usually rainfed; irrigate once or twice (at flowering and pod fill) if dry.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 20:40:20 at sowing per hectare (more phosphorus because lentil fixes N).
Pests & Weeds: Watch for aphids and jassids. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest when pods are brown and seeds rattle in pods (about 100–110 days). Pull plants and sun-dry before threshing.
Storage: Dry pods and store seeds in airtight containers to keep out moisture and pests.

Soil: Well-drained loamy soil, pH 6.5–7.5
Climate: Cool climate with 15–25°C temperature and 50–75 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Rainfed; give 2–3 irrigations during winter if needed (at rosette, flowering, siliqua stages).
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 20:40:20 at sowing per hectare (more phosphorus).
Pests & Weeds: Watch for aphids and painted bug. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest when lower pods turn golden brown (about 120–140 days). Cut and bundle plants or use sickle; thresh after drying.
Storage: Threshed seeds should be dried to ~8% moisture; store in clean bins or bags in a dry place.

Soil: Light sandy loam to loamy soil, pH 6.0–7.0
Climate: Warm climate with 20–30°C temperature and 50–100 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Requires 6–8 irrigations: after sowing, at pegging, and every 15 days until maturity if rain is insufficient.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 25:50:25 at sowing per hectare (groundnut also fixes N).
Pests & Weeds: Watch for leaf miner and aphids. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest when leaves begin to yellow (110–130 days after sowing). Uproot pods carefully; dry in sun.
Storage: Dry pods well (or kernels) before storage; store in cool, dry place to prevent aflatoxin.

Soil: Well-drained loamy soil, pH 6.0–7.0
Climate: Warm climate with 20–30°C temperature and 50–100 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Rainfed; give 1–2 irrigations at pod-filling if drought occurs.
Fertilizer: Soybean requires little nitrogen; apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 20:40:20 at sowing per hectare.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for pod borers and tan spot disease. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest when leaves drop and pods turn brown (about 100–130 days). Cut plants and dry; thresh to get beans.
Storage: Dry beans to <12% moisture and store in airtight containers to avoid moisture.

Soil: Well-drained loamy soil, pH 6.0–7.0
Climate: Moderate climate with 20–30°C temperature and 50–75 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Rabi rainfed; irrigate at flowering and grain fill if needed (1–2 times).
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 40:40:20 at planting per hectare. Top dress 40 kg N at flowering.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for aphids and birds. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest when back of sunflower heads turn yellow-brown and bracts dry (around 100–110 days). Cut and dry heads before threshing.
Storage: Dry seeds to <8% moisture; store in sealed containers to prevent pests.

Soil: Light loamy soil, pH 6.0–7.5
Climate: Warm climate with 25–35°C temperature and 50–100 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Rainfed or light irrigation at flowering in very dry areas.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 10:20:10 at sowing per hectare.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for blister beetle and bird damage. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest when 75% of capsules turn yellow (60–90 days). Pull plants and dry; thresh by beating.
Storage: Dry seeds well and store in cool dry bins; sesame oil is prone to spoil if moisture is high.

Soil: Deep, black cotton soil or loamy soil, pH 6.5–8.0
Climate: Warm climate with 25–35°C temperature and 60–100 cm rainfall
Seed Rate: 20–25 kg/ha (for planting in 1–2 plants per hill)
Irrigation: Rainfed; give 4–5 irrigations if available (after sowing, early growth, flowering, boll development).
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 20:30:20 at planting per hectare.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for bollworms and aphids. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Hand-pick open bolls from October–November. Make 2–3 picks one week apart.
Storage: Store lint cotton in a dry, pest-free place; ginning follows once harvest is complete.

Soil: Loamy to clay loam, rich in organic matter, pH 6.0–7.5
Climate: Tropical to subtropical climate with 20–32°C temperature and 75–150 cm rainfall
Seed Rate: About 10,000–12,000 kg/ha of setts (depending on sett size)
Irrigation: Requires 10–12 irrigations (basin or furrow) at 15–20 day intervals; keep soil moist.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 125:75:75 at planting per hectare. Top dress 50 kg N at 45 and 60 days.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for sugarcane borer and top borer. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest 10–18 months after planting when sugar content is max; cut stalks near ground level.
Storage: Transport to mill immediately; if storing, keep stalks covered and use within 1–2 days to avoid sucrose loss.

Soil: Sandy loam to loamy soil, pH 5.5–7.0
Climate: Cool climate with 15–25°C temperature and 75–125 cm rainfall
Seed Rate: 2,000–2,500 kg/ha of tubers (cut into 2–3 pieces each)
Irrigation: Requires 3–4 irrigations: first after planting, then 10–15 days later, and at tuber initiation if dry.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 150:75:50 at planting per hectare (split N into 2 doses).
Pests & Weeds: Watch for aphids and potato tuber moth. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest when haulm yellows and tubers reach full size (after about 75–90 days). Lift tubers gently with a spade.
Storage: Cure tubers for a few days to heal wounds, then store in cool (7–10°C), dark, well-ventilated place.

Soil: Loamy or sandy loam, rich in organic matter, pH 6.0–7.0
Climate: Warm, humid climate with 20–27°C (night ~15°C) temperature and 60–100 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Regular irrigation (drip or furrow) especially after transplanting; water every 5–7 days once flowering starts.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 100:60:60 at planting per hectare. Top dress 50 kg N and 50 kg K2O in two splits.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for fruit borer and blight. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Pick fruits when they are red and firm (60–80 days from transplant). Multiple harvests possible.
Storage: Keep fruits in cool place (10–15°C). Avoid over-ripening; sort and pack carefully to avoid bruising.

Soil: Deep loamy soil with good drainage, pH 6.0–7.5
Climate: Temperate climate with 20–25°C temperature and 75–100 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Require frequent irrigation (every 2–3 weeks) until bulb initiation; reduce as bulbs mature.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 100:50:50 at sowing per hectare. Top dress 50 kg N in two splits.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for thrips and purple blotch disease. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest when tops fall over and necks dry (100–120 days). Cure bulbs in shade before storage.
Storage: Store in ventilated sheds at 24–26°C and 65–70% humidity to avoid sprouting and rotting.

Soil: Well-drained loamy soil, pH 6.0–6.8
Climate: Warm climate with 20–30°C temperature and 50–100 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Irrigate every 7–10 days, especially during flowering and fruiting.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 50:30:30 at planting per hectare. Top dress 30 kg N in two splits.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for thrips, aphids, and fruit borers. Regular weeding is needed.
Harvesting: Harvest red or green chilies when fruits mature. Pick every 3–4 days.
Storage: Dry red chilies in sun and store in dry bags or containers. Use ventilated storage.

Soil: Fertile, well-drained loamy soil, pH 6.0–6.5
Climate: Cool, mild climate with 18–25°C temperature and moderate humidity
Irrigation: Drip or furrow irrigation every 5–7 days during flowering and fruiting.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 75:50:50 at planting per hectare. Add 30 kg N after flowering.
Pests & Weeds: Control aphids, mites, and powdery mildew. Weed manually or mulch.
Harvesting: Harvest when fruits turn firm and glossy green, yellow, or red depending on variety.
Storage: Store at 7–10°C with 85–90% humidity. Use ventilated crates for packing.

Soil: Alluvial soil with high moisture retention, pH 6.0–7.5
Climate: Hot and humid climate with 25–35°C temperature and 150–200 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Grown in rainfed conditions; maintain moist soil if dry spell.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 60:30:20 at sowing per hectare.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for hairy caterpillar. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding.
Harvesting: Harvest at flowering stage (80–90 days after sowing). Pull plants and bundle; fiber is retted in water.
Storage: Once fibers are extracted and dried, store in bundles in a dry place.

Soil: Loamy soil, pH 6.0–7.0
Climate: Cool climate with 10–25°C temperature and 30–75 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Give 2–3 irrigations: first after sowing, then at tillering and grain filling.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 60:40:20 at sowing per hectare.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for aphids and armyworm. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest at full maturity (grain hard, ~20% moisture). Cut and sun-dry; thresh by beating.
Storage: Dry grains to <12% moisture; store in airtight bags or containers in a cool place.

Soil: Deep, fertile sandy loam to clay loam soil, pH 6.0–7.0
Climate: Tropical climate with 26–30°C temperature and 100–150 cm rainfall
Irrigation: Irrigate frequently (every 2–3 days) as roots are shallow; drip or basin irrigation; maintain high humidity.
Fertilizer: Apply NPK (N:P₂O₅:K₂O) 350:175:450 at planting per hectare. Top dress 150 kg N and 200 kg K2O later.
Pests & Weeds: Watch for nematodes and banana weevil. Keep field weed-free by manual weeding or mulching.
Harvesting: Harvest when fruits are plump and green (8–10 months after planting). Cut the whole bunch carefully.
Storage: Ripen fruit in shade (15–20°C, high humidity); store at 14–16°C (unripe) or 18–20°C for market-ready fruit.
